LanguageData.GameplayTips.DismissLetters: You can dismiss letters by right-clicking on them.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.QueueOrders: You can hold the shift key to queue orders on your colonists.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ReorderColonistbar: You can right-click and drag to reorder colonists on the colonist bar.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.SelectPrevNextColonist: You can select previous/next colonist with the , and . keys.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.SettingPainting: Many menus allow you to click and drag a setting topaint' it over many entries. This even works for things like outfits or food restrictions.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ManualPriorities: In the work tab's manual priorities mode, 1 is first priority, while 4 is last priority.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ColonistMood: Each colonists' mood is displayed in the background of their icon in the colonist bar at the top of the screen.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.WorkTabChangeAllColonists: Shift-clicking the name of a work type in the Work tab changes settings for all colonists at once.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.WorkTabDecreasePriority: Right-clicking a number in the Work tab using manual priorities will reduce the priority instead of increasing it.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.GunfightCover: In a gunfight, always be behind cover!
LanguageData.GameplayTips.GunfightSpread: In a gunfight, spread your colonists out! Bunched-up targets are easy to hit.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ShootingAccuracySmoke: Smoke totally prevents turrets from detecting targets, but people can still shoot with reduced accuracy.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.DesignDefenses: When designing defences, assume enemies will get inside using drop pods or tunnels. Build internal defensive positions.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ShootingAccuracyFogRain: Foggy or rainy weather reduces the accuracy of ranged weapons.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ShootingTooltip: You can analyze the chance a shot will hit by selecting the shooter and placing the mouse over the target.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.TurretsExplode: Turrets explode when they take a lot of damage. Don't put them too close together, and don't put your people too close to them.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalDeathExplosion: Some animals explode upon death. You can use transport pods to drop animals on enemies. Think about it.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CallAllies: If you need help in a fight, call your allies using the comms console.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.MaddenedAnimals: Maddened animals will attack any human, including your enemies. You can use this.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.EMPDisablesTurretsShields: EMP bursts will temporarily disable turrets, mortar shields, and bullet shields.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.EMPDisablesPersonalShields: EMP bursts instantly break personal shields.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.HunterStealth: The hunter stealth stat reduces the chance of animal attacks. It is affected by the hunter's animals and shooting skills.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalsAttackCloseRange: Animals are more likely to attack when harmed from close range. Long-range, slow-firing weapons are safest for hunting.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalsMayAttack: Entire herds of animals may attack you when you try to hunt them. Accept the risk before hunting, or choose weaker prey.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalDeathExplosionRain: If you hunt boomrats and boomalopes when it's raining, their deaths won't cause forest fires.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.GreaterSlaughterYield: Place a caravan packing spot to designate where you want your caravans to form up.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CaravanPackingSpot: Single-person caravans can be very useful in certain situations.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CaravanFasterAnimals: Smaller caravans will be attacked less often because they're less visible.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CaravanSmallerLessVisible: Before forming a caravan, collect them items you want to send in a stockpile near your caravan packing spot. This will make packing much faster.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CaravanStockpileNearPacking: If you have untrained animals in your caravan, you can split them into a separate caravan before attacking an enemy, to keep them out of the fight.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CaravanUntrainedAnimals: RimWorld is a story generator, not a skill test. A ruined colony is a dramatic tragedy, not a failure.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.StoryGenerator: Some colonists are worse than useless. Bad allies are part of the challenge.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.BadAllies: If you can't defend against a threat, make a caravan and run. You may lose your home, but your story can continue.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.MakeCaravanRunBeforeDefeat: Avoid using stone for doors. They open very slowly, which wastes your colonists' time.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.StoneDoors: Put chairs in front of workbenches so workers can sit comfortably while working.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ChairsWorkbench: Mechanical structures break down and require replacement components. Don't build things you don't need.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.MechanicalBreakdown: Be careful what you construct on bridges. Bridges collapse easily under explosions, and your buildings will go with them.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CarefulConstructionOnBridge: Clean rooms increase research speed, improve medical outcomes, and reduce food poisoning. Sterile tiles make rooms extra-clean.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CleanRooms: Building your whole colony in one structure saves resources, but also makes it difficult to contain fires.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ColonyOneStructure: Terrain affects movement speed. Build floors to help your colonists get around quicker.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.TerrainMovementSpeed: Different terrain has different inherent cleanliness levels. Tiles are inherently clean; dirt is inherently dirty.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.TerrainCleanliness: You can give prisoners as gifts. Giving a prisoner back to his own faction will be highly appreciated.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.PrisonersAsGifts: You can request specific types of trade caravans using the comms console.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.RequestTradeCaravans: You can use transport pods to send gifts directly to other factions' bases - even your enemies. This improves faction relations.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.TransportPodsSendGift: Keeping prisoners together saves space. However, prisoners kept together will try to break out together.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.KeepingPrisonersTogether: Enemy faction bases are very well-defended. You don't need to attack them - but be well-prepared if you choose to try.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.EnemyFactionBaseDefenses: Cute tame animals will nuzzle your colonists, improving their mood.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalNuzzle: Assign your herbivorous animals to areas with lots of grass. They'll eat the grass and spare you the need to feed them.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.AnimalHerbivorousGrassArea: If someone has a serious infection in a limb, you can remove the limb to save their life.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.RemoveLimbInfection: Sloshing through water makes people unhappy. Build a bridge when you can.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.SloshingWater: Luciferium can heal scars - even those on the eye or brain. It is, however, a permanent commitment.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.Luciferium: Work and movement speed are affected by lighting. Everything is slower in the dark.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.WorkMovementSpeedLighting: Deep underground caverns have a naturally stable temperature, even if it's very hot or cold outside.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.DeepCavesTemperature: Mountain bases are easy to defend. The downside is that people go crazy spending too long underground. And giant insects.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.MountainBases: Prisoners will join much quicker and attempt fewer breakouts when they're in a good mood.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.PrisonersGoodMood: You can have multiple researchers working simultaneously at multiple research tables.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.MultipleResearchers: Geysers heat up rooms if enclosed. This can be dangerous, or useful.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.GeysersHeatRooms: Explosions extinguish fires in their blast radius. This makes artillery shells useful for stopping fires when there is no other choice.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.ExtinguishFireArtillery: Even serious setbacks don't mean the game has to end. Try playing out a lost battle - often the best stories come from the darkest situations.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.BestStoriesFromDarkestSitua: Clean labs with sterile tile give research speed bonuses.
LanguageData.GameplayTips.CleanLabs: You can change storyteller and difficulty at any time through the options menu.
